quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, reaper, smoke. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Baby One More Time was a huge hit for Britney Spears. However, this comedic punk band made a version of the song on their 2005 LP called _____________________ Goes to the Movies.  Who is the band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bowling For Soup

questions.question: Which band performed the 1980s classic rock song Pour Some Sugar on Me?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Def Leppard

questions.question: Which band performed the 1970s classic rock hit Dont Fear the Reaper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Oyster Cult

questions.question: Which band recorded the 1980s classic rock hit Cum on Feel the Noize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quite Riot

questions.question: On his first LP release, Brian McKnight did a cover of this soulful pop duos hit I Cant Go For That. Name the duo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hall and Oates

questions.question: Which band performed the 1970s classic rock song  Roundabout?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Gin and Juice, originally recorded by Snoop Dogg was covered by this alternative country band on their 2001 LP Shinebox.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gourds

questions.question: Which band performed the 1970s classic rock hit Smoke on the Water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deep Purple

questions.question: In 2000 American Pie was covered by Madonna and released on the soundtrack for the movie The Next Best Thing. Who originally sang American Pie in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don McLean

questions.question: Which band performed the 1970s classic rock song Iron Man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Sabbath

questions.question: Which band performed the 1980s classic rock song Heat of the Moment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asia

questions.question: Which band recorded the 1970s classic rock song Kashmir?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: Which band performed the1970s classic rock song Wont Get Fooled Again?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Who

questions.question: In 1992, Mariah Carey did a live cover of this quintets song Ill Be There. Name the famous sibling group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jackson 5

questions.question: This artist made a watered down version of Little Richards Tutti Frutti to appease pop audiences.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Boone

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Bob Marley and Beatles
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, judge, marley. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which band performed the 1980s classic rock song Livin on a Prayer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bon Jovi

questions.question: In 1980 Bob Marley collapsed while jogging and doctors told him that the cancer had spread through his body. Despite that, he performed his last concert in Pittsburgh on 22 September 1980. Then Bob and his wife flew to Germany, where he was treated by the unconventional Dr. Issels.  His condition improved at first, but Bob Marley later died, on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11 May 1981

questions.question: Which members of the Beatles were left-handed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr

questions.question: Bob Marleys other passion was football. As a result of a neglected football injury, Bob Marley got melanoma cancer in the big toe of his right foot.  Doctors wanted to remove his toe in order to save his life, but Bob refused due to his religious beliefs. What was his religion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rastafari

questions.question: Who was the youngest member of the Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Harrison

questions.question: Bob released his first song, Judge Not, in 1961. It didnt do so well but he wasnt discouraged. How old was Bob Malrey then?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16

questions.question: Which member of the Beatles joked that the bands name came to him in a vision from a man who appeared on a flaming pie and said... You are the Beatles -- with an A?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Bob Marley, Peter Tosh and Bunny Livingstone formed a band in 1965- The Wailers. For many years they released singles, but no albums. However, in 1971 Island Records forwarded them 8,000 pounds to produce a full album. This is the name of their first album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catch a Fire

questions.question: Bob Marley, his wife and his manager were shot on 3 December 1976. That stopped Bob from playing at Smile Jamaica concert in Kingston.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: After The Wailers renamed to Bob Marley and The Wailers, they released an album. It included No Woman No Cry, probably their most famous song. What was the name of the album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natty Dread

questions.question: In 1966 Bob Marley got married. What is the name of his beloved one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rita Anderson

questions.question: Which Beatle was not an original member of the band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo Starr

questions.question: Eric Clapton covered one of the most famous songs of The Wailers. Which one is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Shot The Sheriff

questions.question: Robert Nesta Marley was born in Nine Miles, Jamaica to Norval Marley and Cedella Malcom, on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 February 1945

questions.question: At a concert, Bob Marley persuaded the leaders of the two warring political factions in Jamaica to join him on stage. Then the two rivals shook hands and as a result Bob Marley was awarded the United Nations Peace Medal. What was the name of the concert?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Love

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Member and Beatles
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, college, elvis. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What were the names of  the two songs on the record Elvis recorded for his mom?

options.text: Careless Love and Thats When Your Heartache Begins
My Happiness and Thats When Your Heartache Begins
Mystery Train and Thats Alright Mama

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Happiness and Thats When Your Heartache Begins

questions.question: Who was the woman, once married to George Harrison, who later married one of Georges best friends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pattie Boyd

questions.question: Which member of the Beatles had no children with his first wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Harrison

questions.question: The first marriage of which Beatles member did not end in divorce?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: Which Elvis movie was originally titled The Reno Brothers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love Me Tender

questions.question: Which member of the Beatles attended the Liverpool College of Art before joining the band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Which Beatles member became a devout adherent of philosophies and scriptures of Hinduism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Harrison

questions.question: Which Beatles member staged a bed-in for peace with his new wife on their honeymoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: James was the given name of which member of the Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: Which member of the Beatles narrated the childrens television series, Thomas the Tank Engine and Friends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo Starr

questions.question: Who was the oldest member of the Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo Starr

questions.question: Which Beatles member married a former Bond girl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo Starr

questions.question: Elvis paid how much to make a record for his moms birthday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $3.98

questions.question: Which member of the Beatles formed the band Wings after the breakup of the Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: Two days after the death of Elvis, a drunk driver drove his car into a crowd of mourners outside of Graceland injuring five fans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Elvis and Kinks
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, girlfriends, example. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1960s Tom Jones was famous for his overt sexuality.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: One of these statements about The Who is wrong.

options.text: They left a certain influence on music.
There are no incorrect statements.  All of these are true.
Their music can be characterized with distorted guitars and epic songwriting.
They produced one of the first rock operas (Tommy).

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: There are no incorrect statements.  All of these are true.

questions.question: Who was Elvis Presleys girlfriend at the time of his death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginger Alden

questions.question: On the morning of Elvis funeral, it took how many vans to move the flowers from Graceland to the cemetery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100

questions.question: Blowin In The Wind is a premier example of a protest song by Bob Dylan.  It was released in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1963

questions.question: Shortly after the death of Elvis, who referred to Elvis as bloated and over-the hill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marlon Brando

questions.question: Elvis Presley was born in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mississippi

questions.question: One of these albums of The Beatles was not released in the 60s in the UK.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Let It Be

questions.question: What song was recorded by two generations of Presleys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Cry Daddy

questions.question: Elvis was laid to rest wearing this clothing.

options.text: White suit, blue shirt and silver tie
Gold suit, white shirt and gold tie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White suit, blue shirt and silver tie

questions.question: The Monkees were a four-man band who appeared in an American television series of the same name, which ran on this channel from 1966 to 1968.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NBC

questions.question: Which one of Elvis Presleys girlfriends was a former Miss Tennessee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Linda Thompson

questions.question: One of these songs of Rolling Stones has the following opening lines:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart of Stone

questions.question: The Kinks had this name before being called The Kinks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ravens

questions.question: In what film did Elvis Presleys mom and dad make an appearance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Loving You

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Singer and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, drama, glitter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following members of Mötley Crüe is the lead guitarist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mick Mars

questions.question: A few seconds of the introduction should be all that is necessary to identify this heavy metal classic. Name the song in the audio clip with the legendary intro.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crazy Train

questions.question: Which of these actresses was never romantically linked to Elvis Presley?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goldie Hawn

questions.question: Van Halen is known for the drama surrounding the departure of their lead singer, David Lee Roth, and his replacement, Sammy Hagar.  Which of the following albums was recorded with Hagar and not Diamond Dave?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5150

questions.question: This group can proudly say they never succumbed to the hairspray, glitter and lipstick as many of their contemporaries did in the 1980s.  Their albums Kill Em All, Ride the Lightning, Master of Puppets, and And Justice for All earned them a loyal following without having to sell out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metallica

questions.question: This Australian singer hit it big with songs like Delta Dawn, Angie Baby, and Somewhere in the Night. She also sang Candle on the Water for the 1977 Disney movie Petes Dragon. The sound clip is from a minor hit Summer of 71.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Reddy

questions.question: In 1976 this adult film star reached #4 on the Billboard charts with More, More, More. Although the porn star would not produce any additional hits, the song would be heavily sampled on the top ten hit Steal My Sunshine by Len in 1999.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrea True

questions.question: This model was romantically linked to INXS lead singer Michael Hutchence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helena Christensen

questions.question: Anna Kournikova secretly married Ricky Martin in 2003.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: This adult film star married Evan Seinfeld of Biohazard in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tera Patrick

questions.question: Renee Zellweger dated White Stripes Jack White before marrying Kenny Chesney.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Shannon Tweed married KISS lead singer Gene Simmons in 2005.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Name the band featured in the audio clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guns N Roses

questions.question: She married Lenny Kravitz on her 20th birthday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lisa Bonet

questions.question: With the help of keyboardist Daryl Dragon, this singer topped the charts with hits like Lonely Night (Angel Face) and Shop Around. The sound clip is from You Never Done It Like That.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toni Tennille

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Sound
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, habit. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There was something about the incredible harmonies between Anni-Frid Frida Lyngstad and Agnetha Fältskog that fit the melodies perfectly. Their hit songs include SOS, Waterloo, and Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (sound clip). Name their band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ABBA

questions.question: He is famous as the owner of the Moon River Theater in Branson, Missouri. He had his own TV show, recorded 18 gold albums, and in the 1960s was signed to what was at that time the biggest recording contract in history. [sound clip: Music To Watch Girls By]
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andy Williams

questions.question: He was the voice of the orangutan King Louie in the Walt Disney film The Jungle Book. Known as the King of Swing, his medley of Just a Gigolo/I Aint Got Nobody was covered by David Lee Roth in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis Prima

questions.question: Free to Be ... You and Me, first an album in 72 then a TV special in 74, was put together by actress Marlo Thomas to teach children life lessons. It featured everyone from Mel Brooks and Alan Alda to Dick Cavett and Kris Kristofferson. The song When I Grow Up (sound clip) was performed by Michael Jackson and this famous singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diana Ross

questions.question: This singer and her guitarist sister were greatly influenced by Led Zeppelin and rocked harder than most bands with female leads throughout the latter half of the 70s. The 80s revealed a kinder and gentler band with radio-friendly pop hits like Alone. The sound clip is from the bands Zeppelin influenced Love Alive. Name the lead singer of the band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ann Wilson

questions.question: Which member of the famous Rat Pack was called by Playboy magazine the coolest man who ever lived and recorded such hits as Thats Amore, Everybody Loves Somebody, and Volare.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dean Martin

questions.question: In 1966, Mas Que Nada was recorded by Sergio Mendes  _________ (fill in the blank)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brasil 66

questions.question: This artist scored it big with I Love the Nightlife (Disco Round) in 1978. She was unable to follow it up with similar chart success, but the song remains a disco anthem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alicia Bridges

questions.question: This singers soothing voice could spin literally any tune into pure gold: from The Beatles Ticket to Ride to Burt Bacharachs Close to You, and Klaatus Calling Occupants of Interplanetary Craft as heard in the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karen Carpenter

questions.question: Have You Never Been Mellow, Magic, A Little More Love, and Suddenly are but a few of the hits by this singer from Down Under. The sound clip is from the Xanadu soundtrack.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olivia Newton-John

questions.question: This singers distinctive voice dominated the airwaves throughout the 1970s. The 1971 song Thats the Way Ive Always Heard It Should Be featured in the sound clip was an early hit, only to be followed by many, many more successful singles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carly Simon

questions.question: In 1994, this artist performed his 25,000th solo show in Las Vegas. Frank, Dino, Sammy ... theyre all gone, but he still holds his ground and keeps the ties to old Vegas alive. For that, he deserves a great big Danke Schoen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wayne Newton

questions.question: Comedians have a bad habit of lampooning lounge acts. An example of this is demonstrated in the sound clip provided: Ice, Ice Baby by comedian Richard Cheese and his band Lounge Against the Machine. Which Saturday Night Live comedian portrayed a particularly bad lounge act famous for his terrible rendition of Star Wars and Feelings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Murray

questions.question: This vocalist was at the forefront of the British folk rock movement. While not exactly a household name in the U.S., she was admired by many including Led Zeppelin who featured her beautiful voice on their song The Battle of Evermore. The sound clip is from Tam Lin- a song from her years with Fairport Convention.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandy Denny

questions.question: Although this girl group began in 1963,  they wouldnt reach real chart success until 1974 with the song When Will I See You Again (sound clip) which reached #2 in the US.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Three Degrees
